summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people!
She is become as a widow, that was great among the nations!
She that was a princess among the provinces is become tributary!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And from the daughter of Zion all her majesty is departed:
Her princes are become like harts that find no pasture,
And they are gone without strength before the pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem remembereth in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that were from the days of old:
When her people fell into the hand of the adversary, and none did help her,
The adversaries saw her, they did mock at her desolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The adversary hath spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things:
For she hath seen that the nations are entered into her sanctuary,
Concerning whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thine assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by?
Behold, and see if there be any sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is brought upon me,
Wherewith Jehovah hath afflicted me in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment:
Hear, I pray you, all ye peoples, and behold my sorrow:
My virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called for my lovers, but they deceived me:
My priests and mine elders gave up the ghost in the city,
While they sought them food to refresh their souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How hath the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger!
He hath cast down from heaven unto the earth the beauty of Israel,
And hath not remembered his footstool in the day of his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He hath bent his bow like an enemy, he hath stood with his right hand as an adversary,
And hath slain all that were pleasant to the eye:
In the tent of the daughter of Zion he hath poured out his wrath like fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And he hath violently taken away his tabernacle, as if it were of a garden; he hath destroyed his place of assembly:
Jehovah hath caused solemn assembly and sabbath to be forgotten in Zion,
And hath despised in the indignation of his anger the king and the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They say to their mothers, Where is grain and wine?
When they swoon as the wounded in the streets of the city,
When their soul is poured out into their mothers’ bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I testify unto thee? what shall I liken to thee, O daughter of Jerusalem?
What shall I compare to thee, that I may comfort thee, O virgin daughter of Zion?
For thy breach is great like the sea: who can heal thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
See, O Jehovah, and behold to whom thou hast done thus!
Shall the women eat their fruit, the children that are dandled in the hands?
Shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuary of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath led me and caused me to walk in darkness, and not in light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely against me he turneth his hand again and again all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath walled me about, that I cannot go forth; he hath made my chain heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, when I cry, and call for help, he shutteth out my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath walled up my ways with hewn stone; he hath made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is unto me as a bear lying in wait, as a lion in secret places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; he hath made me desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my reins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am become a derision to all my people, and their song all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath sated me with wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones; he hath covered me with ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace; I forgat prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, My strength is perished, and mine expectation from Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is bowed down within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I recall to my mind; therefore have I hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is of Jehovah’s lovingkindnesses that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are new every morning; great is thy faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good that a man should hope and quietly wait for the salvation of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him sit alone and keep silence, because he hath laid it upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him put his mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him give his cheek to him that smiteth him; let him be filled full with reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he doth not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the mouth of the Most High cometh there not evil and good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled; thou hast not pardoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast covered with anger and pursued us; thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast made us an offscouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear and the pit are come upon us, devastation and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine eye runneth down with streams of water, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine eye poureth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till Jehovah look down, and behold from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine eye affecteth my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have chased me sore like a bird, they that are mine enemies without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and have cast a stone upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Waters flowed over my head; I said, I am cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called upon thy name, O Jehovah, out of the lowest dungeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou heardest my voice; hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee; thou saidst, Fear not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, thou hast seen my wrong; judge thou my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their devices against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Jehovah, and all their devices against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold thou their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou wilt render unto them a recompense, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou wilt give them hardness of heart, thy curse unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou wilt pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How is the gold become dim! how is the most pure gold changed!
The stones of the sanctuary are poured out at the head of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold,
How are they esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the jackals draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones:
The daughter of my people is become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of his mouth for thirst:
The young children ask bread, and no man breaketh it unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets:
They that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom,
That was overthrown as in a moment, and no hands were laid upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her nobles were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk;
They were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was as of sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their visage is blacker than a coal; they are not known in the streets:
Their skin cleaveth to their bones; it is withered, it is become like a stick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that are slain with the sword are better than they that are slain with hunger;
For these pine away, stricken through, for want of the fruits of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hands of the pitiful women have boiled their own children;
They were their food in the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath accomplished his wrath, he hath poured out his fierce anger;
And he hath kindled a fire in Zion, which hath devoured the foundations thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth believed not, neither all the inhabitants of the world,
That the adversary and the enemy would enter into the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is because of the sins of her prophets, and the iniquities of her priests,
That have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wander as blind men in the streets, they are polluted with blood,
So that men cannot touch their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart ye, they cried unto them, Unclean! depart, depart, touch not!
When they fled away and wandered, men said among the nations, They shall no more sojourn here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The anger of Jehovah hath scattered them; he will no more regard them:
They respected not the persons of the priests, they favored not the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our eyes do yet fail in looking for our vain help:
In our watching we have watched for a nation that could not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They hunt our steps, so that we cannot go in our streets:
Our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the heavens:
They chased us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of Jehovah, was taken in their pits;
Of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, that dwellest in the land of Uz:
The cup shall pass through unto thee also; thou shalt be drunken, and shalt make thyself naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will no more carry thee away into captivity:
He will visit thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom; he will uncover thy sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Jehovah, what is come upon us:
Behold, and see our reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our inheritance is turned unto strangers,
Our houses unto aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are orphans and fatherless;
Our mothers are as widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have drunken our water for money;
Our wood is sold unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers are upon our necks:
We are weary, and have no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have given the hand to the Egyptians,
And to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our fathers sinned, and are not;
And we have borne their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Servants rule over us:
There is none to deliver us out of their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We get our bread at the peril of our lives,
Because of the sword of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our skin is black like an oven,
Because of the burning heat of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ravished the women in Zion,
The virgins in the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes were hanged up by their hand:
The faces of elders were not honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young men bare the mill;
And the children stumbled under the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elders have ceased from the gate,
The young men from their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The joy of our heart is ceased;
Our dance is turned into mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown is fallen from our head:
Woe unto us! for we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this our heart is faint;
For these things our eyes are dim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the mountain of Zion, which is desolate:
The foxes walk upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou, O Jehovah, abidest for ever;
Thy throne is from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever,
And forsake us so long time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn thou us unto thee, O Jehovah, and we shall be turned;
Renew our days as of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thou hast utterly rejected us;
Thou art very wroth against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
